intro: Impatiens bemarahensis, commonly known as the Bemara impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the genus Impatiens in the family Balsaminaceae, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually single, with five petals and a spur, and are pollinated primarily by insects. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
